title: Murmurings from rugged waters.
author: Broomfield, James Polwarth. [from old catalog]
snippet: There stood, or perhaps there stands to-day, the ruined wing of an old castle on the banks of the river Kayle, near the village of Hownam — a crumbling memory of a family whose motto, "We take who dare," was known and heard of for many a mile on both sides of the Border.
